title: Enhanced for with var
summary: Use var in for-each loops to reduce generic type noise.
explanation: When iterating over collections with complex generic types, var in the loop variable reduces clutter while the compiler still knows and enforces the exact type.

whyModernWins.title: Less noise
whyModernWins.desc: Complex generic types in loops obscure the logic.

whyModernWins.title: Same safety
whyModernWins.desc: Type inference is compile-time ‚Äî no runtime penalty.

whyModernWins.title: Refactor-friendly
whyModernWins.desc: Change the collection type and the loop var adjusts automatically.
